abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Justice Services
            Strengthening Project for Colombia is to strengthen the
            capacity of the Judiciary and the Ministry of Interior and
            Justice (MIJ) to deliver timely, efficient, effective and
            quality dispute resolution services to citizens. The
            reallocation is necessary to shift proceeds of the loan
            across categories of expenditure as presented in detail in
            table no. 1. The reallocation will shift US$400,000 from the
            unallocated category of Expenditures to part C.1 of the
            project in order to adequately finance the justice services
            map implemented under the Ministry of Justice and Law. The
            justice services map allows citizens to access, via the web,
            a directory of geo-referenced judicial institutions in order
            to locate the closest institution to initiate the procedures
            required to enforce users' rights. In order to improve
            the usefulness of the justice services map, by making the
            system's information more user-friendly and ensuring
            that the information contained therein is current and
            addresses the different queries of citizenship, it is
            necessary to carry out a process of updating the
            portal's information system (legal and contact), as
            well as its graphic design to align it with the image of the
            Ministry of Justice and Law and the provisions of the
            'online government'. The goal of this initiative
            is to diminish the delay in the resolution of certain types
            of cases, such as, debt cases where there is no opposition
            of the debtor and the plaintiff is a bank or other financial
            corporation. The reallocated amounts will also be used for
            initiatives related to the creation of the electronic file
            ('e-file') in the labor, civil and family courts.
            Due to their nature, these activities will require a
            considerable investment in technological equipment to allow
            the judicial branch to improve the organization of their
            archives by improving the search process of files, as well
            as to significantly reduce the space required for archiving
            facilities. Finally, a minimal amount of the resources
            reallocated to category one will be used to complete the
            funding of other activities that are currently under execution.
